payload.title: Arriving at DXB
payload.description: Dubai International (DXB) is divided into three terminals. **Terminal 3** is exclusively for Emirates; **Terminal 2** is across the runway and handles budget carriers like flydubai.
payload.criticalAlert: You cannot pay for the Metro with cash or a standard credit card at the gate. You **must** purchase a 'Nol Card' from the vending machines before entering the platform.
tips: **Terminal 2 Users:** There is no Metro station at T2. You must take a taxi or a shuttle bus to the nearest station (Abu Hail).
**Taxi Surcharge:** Taxis originating from the airport have a mandatory 25د.إ base fare. This is normal.
**Nol Card:** Get the 'Silver Card' if staying more than 2 days; it's the most cost-effective for Metro and Buses.
**Smart Gates:** If your passport has a biometric chip, use the Smart Gates for 10-second immigration.

payload.title: Money & Digital Pay
payload.description: Dubai is an ultra-modern digital economy. Apple Pay and Google Pay are accepted almost everywhere, from luxury malls to small shawarma shops.
payload.criticalAlert: While cards are king, you will need physical cash (AED) for the **Abra (Water Taxis)** in Old Dubai and some stalls in the Gold Souk.
tips: **Exchange:** Avoid exchanging money at the airport. Use the Al Ansari or UAE Exchange booths inside any major mall for better rates.
**VAT Refund:** Save your receipts! Tourists can claim a 5% VAT refund at 'Planet' kiosks in the airport before flying out.
**No Hidden Fees:** Most bank ATMs in Dubai (ADCB, Emirates NBD) do not charge local fees to foreign cards beyond your own bank's charges.

payload.title: Laws & Local Etiquette
payload.description: Dubai is ranked as one of the safest cities globally. Common sense and respect for local customs will ensure a trouble-free trip.
payload.criticalAlert: Dubai has a **Strict Zero Tolerance** policy for drink-driving and public intoxication. Always use a taxi or Careem after visiting a lounge or brunch.
tips: **The 'Lexus' Taxi:** In the Careem app, a standard 'Hala Taxi' is the cheapest. If you select 'Careem Kids' or 'Lexus,' you will pay a premium.
**Public Display of Affection:** Keep PDA minimal in public spaces (malls/metro) to avoid unwanted attention or fines.
**Photography:** Avoid taking photos of government buildings or people without their explicit permission.
